docs.lead_paragraph: With victories Tuesday in Wisconsin and Hawaii, Barack Obama has won the past 10 Democratic contests and created a critical situation for Hillary Rodham Clinton in the next set of primaries, Ohio and Texas. (There's a two-week break here in contests, folks, the longest stretch we've had so far without a match since the season began. There is, however, another debate tomorrow night between the Democratic candidates in Texas.)

headline.main: The Early Word: Turning to Texas and Ohio

docs.abstract: With a new set of wins under their belt, John McCain and Barack Obama turn their attention to Texas -- where Hillary Rodham Clinton looks to stop the Obama momentum.
docs.snippet: With a new set of wins under their belt, John McCain and Barack Obama turn their attention to Texas -- where Hillary Rodham Clinton looks to stop the Obama momentum.

docs.lead_paragraph: Joseph W. Brown Jr. got an inkling three weeks ago that retirement would have to wait. Former colleagues began calling to lament the tough times facing MBIA, the bond insurance company he used to run.

headline.main: Bond Insurer in Turmoil Turns to Familiar Leader

docs.abstract: Joseph W. Brown Jr. got an inkling three weeks ago that retirement would have to wait. Former colleagues began calling to lament the tough times facing MBIA, the bond insurance company he used to run. So Mr. Brown, 59, started selling some of his prized vintage sports cars – his collection includes Ferraris, Porsches, BMWs [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: As municipal bond auctions fail, it is becoming clear that the auction-rate market is in crisis and chaos, and many securities may never have a successful auction again.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rather than concentrate only on a cure for a common form of muscular dystrophy, researchers are now intent on alleviating its effects.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrest of David M. Tarloff, a man with a long history of mental illness, in the fatal stabbing of a psychologist in Manhattan has revived discussion on the thorny issue of how people with severe mental illnesses can be helped, even when they resist that assistance.

headline.main: Murder Case Focuses New Attention on Mental Illness Treatment

docs.abstract: Legal experts say that improvements in mental health care are needed more than new laws.
docs.snippet: Legal experts say that improvements in mental health care are needed more than new laws.
